fields.description:
look into the cause of the gadget plugin unit test failure in the newly created branch plugins build.

and then fix it :)

this is what has caused the qa build to fail over the past 3 weeks but since we only had a trunk build of the plugins we didn't notice what commit caused the failure.

it may be the test or the production code.
fields.summary: investigate and fix plugins branch build failure cause

fields.description:
When commenting on an issue and the box fills up the entire page (such as in small browser windows or on low resolution screens), the *Add* and *Cancel* buttons go off the bottom of the page.
Scrolling the issue doesn't help as the stalking comment box floats from the top of the page, along with the issue contents not being viewable.
fields.summary: Comment form buttons aren't visible by scrolling when box fills up the browser window.
Allow for searching on time between creation and resolution

fields.description: Add a report to JIRA that shows the bug count per week or day (in form of a chart or just numbers) to see how the project is progressing and at what point the number of found bugs is dropping.
fields.summary: Report: bug count per week or day

fields.description: JRA-14543 needs to be re-oponed and resolved.  There is no reason that JIRA shouldn't be able to handle replies back from Outlook.  Every other major bug tracking system supports this.  Your clients shouldn't rely on other clients for solutions and then have to modify your code base for something that should already be part of the package.
fields.summary: Issue JRA-14543 Needs to be Reopened - Outlook Replies
Subtask bulk edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21300].
  {panel}

For the most part, Jira uses floating tip windows to provide help for the item under the cursor. for example, the activity stream icon containing a text bubble with a + brings up a tip with "Add Commment".

This is slightly helpful.

A much more powerful way to use these tips is to allow actual data from the issue or other parts of the Jira configuration to be displayed.

For example, when hovering over a project name in the projects gadget, I want to see the project description, which Jira allows to be configured for each project. It is hilarous to me how difficult it is for a user to find where the description of each project is displayed. It would be perfect if it came up when hovering over the project name anywhere in the GUI, but especially in the Projects gadget.

I understand that using tips this way may provide a challenge for screen readers and other accessibility mechanisms. If this is the case, you could make it a per-user preference to select whether tips were used simply for help or much more usefully for contextual information.

This is related to a similar suggestion I made in JRA-21299.
fields.summary: Make more use of floating tips with useful descriptions from the Jira instance

fields.description:
My number one convenience wish is for the activity stream gadget to allow a configuration option which would limit the number of comment lines displayed when an issue is commmented. Rather than display the entire comment, a busy site would display only the first 2-5 lines of the comment. The viewer could either go to the issue to get more info or hover over the comment snippet and see the entire commment (properly formatted and with some way to gracefully handle extermely large comments which would otherwise fill the entire screen) in a floating tip or help window.

Alternatively, there could be some kind of interface for expanding and collapsing each comment, but I prefer the floating tip.
fields.summary: Make number of comment lines displayed in Activity Stream a configuration option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21294].
  {panel}

_Some of our customers believe that JIRA should implement a similar functionality to the Confluence one - [CONF-11554|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11554]._

{quote}
The standard 500/server error page displays large amounts of information about the server. While this is very convenient for troubleshooting, it's a problem in environments where security is a major concern and it's important to provide as little information as possible to potential attackers.
We can, and currently have to, ask customers to customise 500page.jsp themselves. However, it should be easy enough for us to include an alternative version which simply shows the following:

CONFLUENCE
System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

Please contact your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
2. attach the application server log file (if possible). 
{quote}

*WORKAROUND:*

If you want to remove information from 500 page, follow this guide:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Remove+information+from+the+500+page
fields.summary: Alternative 500page.jsp with minimal information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21293].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 30 May 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

While this suggestion has gathered significant interest, we're unable to implement all of the excellent suggestions you make. We don't plan to work on this for the foreseeable future. This suggestion will be reviewed in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

We understand this decision will be disappointing to everyone who voted for this issue. While we believe this suggestion would improve the product, after careful review of the most pressing needs of our customers, we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including:

Performance and stability improvements
 Archiving projects for improved performance
 Optimising the use of custom fields
 Improving performance of boards
 Improving Jira notifications
 Allowing users to edit shared filters and dashboards
 Mobile app for Jira Server
 We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our approach to highly voted server suggestions here.

To learn more on how your suggestions are reviewed, see our updated workflow for server feature suggestions.

Kind regards,
 Jakub Kurcek
 Jira Server Product Management
{panel}
This also includes renaming 'Priority' to 'Severity' as some customers prefer to use severity.
fields.summary: Rename any system field via the admin section

If you click into the gadget contents area or try to highlight the gadget contents area, you will see the contents is inside the gadget but the gadget height is too small to display the entire contents of the gadget.

fields.description:
I know this has been though the system several times, but its causes quite a bit of confusion.

Every other tool on the planet uses "Severity" where JIRA uses "Priority".
This is causing confusion between us and our customers as well as project planning (we can't actually add a "Priority" field now without adding more confusion.

Its pretty obvious that the word priority is well entrenched in the Jira code and database, but I think that something should be done about it sooner rather than later.

I am about to go and try renaming it by hacking JIRA as I've seen a few suggestions for, however I should have to.
fields.summary: CLONE -CLONE -Renaming 'Priority' to 'Severity'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21286].
  {panel}

Bizarrely this bug only seems to occur when the Anyone "group" has admin or sysadmin permissions (as set in permission schemes). It results in a call to UserUtilImpl.getGroup with a null group (which I guess, but am not sure is supposed to represent the Anyone group). This in turn may throw an exception, depending on what is backing it.

Luckily it is unusual for people to grant admin access to Anyone, so this is unlikely to affect too many customers.

The workaround is to replace the Anyone group where it is used in the permissions scheme with a group containing all users.



An example stack trace that occurs in this situation is (though I doubt this problem is limited to Studio or GreenHopper)

fields.description:
We have set a custom regular expression requiring that our project keys be in the form letter plus one or two numbers. We have also set a corresponding error message. However, when I try to set a project key (RCA) which is invalid under the regular expression I still get the regular error message (at least two characters containing only uppercase letters) which is wrong.

Somewhere our error message got lost.
fields.summary: Incorrect Project Key Error Message

fields.description:
The ability to force a dashboard to a team is valuable. If you have a larger team and want everyone to use the same default dashboard to control the message, there is currently no way to do that.

fields.description:
Currently, filters and dashboards are restricted to one owner. On a larger team, it quickly becomes valuable to share ownership with a group of people managing the communication and knowledge sharing over the team.

Hacks include creating a dummy shared account for managing shared filters and dashboards, but that is a pain. There is no ability to change the ownership either.

Senario:
# Joe creates some cool dashboards and filters that 200 people sign up to see
# Joe leaves the company

Senario:
# Joe creates some cool dashboards and filters that 200 people sign up to see
# Joe gets moved to another project or becomes too busy to maintain it
fields.summary: Allow Filters and Dashboards to be owned by a group or change the owner

fields.description:
When performing a move operation on an issue, the state of that issue is not stored independently of the state of move operations in other issues going on in other tabs.  This is important in cases where a user needs to move a lot of issues but does not have permissions to bulk move.

To reproduce:

Open multiple issues in separate tabs
Move the issues using the "Move this issue" option in the left column.

1) put the mouse cursor over the "move" link
2) click
3) ctrl-tab
4) goto (2), repeat until all issues are on the "move issue" page
5) select the project to move to
6) ctrl-tab
7) goto (5), repeat until all issues have the correct move-to project selected
8) move the mouse cursor over the "next>>" button
9) click
10) ctrl-tab
11) goto (9), repeat until all issues are on the confirmation page
12) move the mouse cursor over the "Move" button
13) click
14) ctrl-tab
15) goto (13), repeat until all issues are moved

Instead of moving each issue that was originally seen in each of the tabs, only the last viewed issue will be moved multiple times.
fields.summary: JIRA does not store the state of a move operation independently per browser tab

fields.description:
If I enter typographic quotes in the summary, the description, or a comment of an issue, Jira 4.0 replaces them with ASCII quotes. Jira 4.1 leaves them alone in comments, but does replace them with ASCII quotes in the summary.

By "typographic quotes", I am referring to the following Unicode code points:
* U+201c LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK
* U+201d RIGHT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK
* U+2018 LEFT SINGLE QUOTATION MARK
* U+2019 RIGHT SINGLE QUOTATION MARK

This replacement is especially annoying for issues in the German language, because we use U+201e DOUBLE LOW-9 QUOTATION MARK as opening quote (which is not replaced by an ASCII quote) and U+201c LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK as closing quote (which _does_ get replaced by an ASCII quotation mark.

Allow me to demonstrate: This looks, frankly, quite „silly".
fields.summary: Typographic quotes are replaced by ASCII quotes

fields.description:
The new create-issue section in the header (projects tab) will not properly handle absolute URLs for custom icons.  The contextPath is obtained regardless of the content of the custom icon field.  So, an icon path defined as:

http://some.server.somewhere.com/jiraIcons/differenticon.jpg

would render as:

http://my.jira.server.com/jirahttp://some.server.somewhere.com/jiraIcons/differenticon.jpg

on the final page.

The offending code has been found in the "hasCreateIssuePermissionForProject" block in the following files (2 occurrences in each file).  I fixed my instance locally by moving these files into the edit-webapp folder, removing the call to getContextPath(), and rebuilding the app.  This is an acceptable short-term workaround, but the feature should work similar to the other dynamic icons in the app.

Files identified as having this defect:

webapp/secure/views/browser/browseproject.jsp
webapp/secure/views/browser/browseversion.jsp
webapp/secure/views/browser/browsecomponent.jsp

This issue is similar to JRA-20664.  This issue is also similar to JRA-6794 and JRA-14647 which seem to have been addressed previously.
fields.summary: New headers do not properly handle absolute URL for custom icons

fields.description:
As can be seen in this thread the setenv.sh is not correct in the standalone distribution of 4.1.1
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=43700&start=0&tstart=0

There are a lot of variables that somehow are not escaped right and therefore do not affect the memory setting at all. 
Perm gen stays at 84 MB and therefore the script terminates with out of memory errors.

With a simple string like this (instead of the large script) it could be sorted out:

JAVA_OPTS="-Xms128m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Dfile.encoding=UTF8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true"

export JAVA_OPTS


We had a similar problem already in 4.0 see below.... 

--------------------

If the standalone JIRA is installed under path consisting the space character e.g. "/opt/support applications/atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0-standalone"

The setenv.sh script fails to set correctly the installation path variable "PRGDIR" and in the same time detect the JVM type.

As the result of this bug the JVM is set with the default amount of memory assigned to PermGen by Tomcat - 64MB!

Since for JIRA 4.0 requires much more memory, in matter of minutes the application crashes with "javax.servlet.ServletException: PermGen space"

We should escape variables in the following places
{noformat}
PRGDIR=`dirname $0`					      |	PRGDIR=`dirname "$0"`
JAVA_OPTS="-Xms128m -Xmx256m $JAVA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=t (
							      (
# Perm Gen size needs to be increased if encountering OutOfMe (
JIRA_MAX_PERM_SIZE=256m					      (
if [ -f "${PRGDIR}/permgen.sh" ]; then			      (
    echo "Detecting JVM PermGen support..."		      (
    . ${PRGDIR}/permgen.sh				      |	    . "${PRGDIR}/permgen.sh"
    if [ $JAVA_PERMGEN_SUPPORTED = "true" ]; then	      (
        echo "PermGen switch is supported. Setting to ${JIRA_ (
        JAVA_OPTS="-XX:MaxPermSize=${JIRA_MAX_PERM_SIZE} ${JA (
    else						      (
        echo "PermGen switch is NOT supported and will NOT be (
    fi							      (
fi							      (
							      (
# use this if you want to import data without notifications   (
#JAVA_OPTS=" -Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true -Datlassian.m (
							      (
export JAVA_OPTS					      (
							      (
echo "If you encounter issues starting up JIRA Standalone Edi (
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unix shell startup script setenv.sh doesn't set PermGen option

fields.description:
*Description*:
After running the JIRA installer, the application will not run from the Start menu. 

*Cause*:
The 'service.bat' file in version 4.0 has the default service name set to JIRA300410144737 (lines 43 to 45) as seen here:
rem Set default Service name
set SERVICE_NAME=JIRA300410144737
set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA 4.0

while version 4.1.1, has it set to Tomcat6 which is what caused this whole (tiny) mess (lines 58 to 60):
rem Set default Service name
set SERVICE_NAME=Tomcat6
set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA 4.1.1 6

This settings might cause problems when you try to install JIRA as service if you already have a service with the name Tomcat6 installed on your system.

*Workaround*
Start and stop the service directly from the service menu.

To get the start menu working correctly:
# Look at the service name. Right-click the service and choose properties. Notice it's Tomcat6.
# Change <jira-install>/start_service.bat to {{net start Tomcat6}}

If you also have a service called Tomcat6, you can change the service name in service.bat, uninstall and reinstall the service. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+Standalone+as+a+Service for how to uninstall and reinstall the service.
fields.summary: Unable to run from start menu after installation due to Service name on JIRA 4.0 and JIRA 4.1.1 has different SERVICE_NAME description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21242].
  {panel}

Currently, Google have a number of restrictions on their mail service, including 

# maximum number of emails sent per day per account (2000)
# rate at which emails can be sent
# attachment restrictions
# and others.

If any of these (still yet defined) limits is reached, Google will refuse the login with a 421 and the mail service then needs to be manually restarted via the GUI. It would be better if the JIRA SMTP service would back off when a 421 is returned for a determined time and then attempt again. (perhaps we could include a Google 'template' or option for connectivity?

A potential workaround includes using postfix server locally to cache outgoing messages from JIRA - it would queue, resend, and respond as required, and this would override current issues with the JIRA mail handler that have now been exposed through Google's terms of service.
fields.summary: improve the SMTP handler to better accomodate Google restrictions on mail service

fields.description:
Despite a previous Jira issue on this being closed and marked "Fixed", there is still no way to access the contents of an attachment using the SOAP or XmlRpc interfaces (see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11180)

Eg: If I hover on an attachment in the Jira sandbox (in a web browser), I see the following URL:
http://sandbox.onjira.com/secure/attachment/10074/xyz.jar

Both JiraSoapService.getAttachmentsForIssue() and RemoteIssue.getAttachmentnames() return only "xyz.jar" for the filename.
I know that I accessed the Soap interface on (in this case) "http://sandbox.onjira.com/", so my code can supply this, but how do I construct the "/secure/attachment/10074/" part?

And, as pointed out in a comment to JRA11180, if the Jira instance requires authentication, then constructing the URL is probably still useless, and in fact the SOAP API needs to provide the means, for example with a RemoteAttachment.openStream() method ala java.net.URL.
fields.summary: Jira SOAP API provides no way to download an Attachment

fields.summary: Gautam created this bug on 05/05/2010.

fields.description:
If you give JIRA "too much" heap (e.g. 2 or 3 GB) then you may get a stack trace that looks like: {code} HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [ViewIssue]:OutOfMemoryError likely caused by the Sun VM Bug described in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-1566; try calling FSDirectory.setReadChunkSize with a a value smaller than the current chunk size (104857600)

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: OutOfMemoryError likely caused by the Sun VM Bug described in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-1566; try calling FSDirectory.setReadChunkSize with a a value smaller than the current chunk size (104857600) at
{code}

If you look at [LUCENE-1566|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-1566] you can see that the actual problem is a [bug in Sun's 32-bit JVMs|http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6478546] that Lucene trips over. In Lucene 2.9 (which is in JIRA 4.1) they have added a workaround the handles *most* heap sizes but if you go too large (say 3GB) then you still trip over the problem.

From what I can tell this could happen on any version of JIRA. Since we haven't had users complaining then it must not be a very common occurence. We tripped over it on SAC mostly by accident.

I think trying to have JIRA handle this would add Yet Another Configuration Knob for what appears to be a very rare case. As Chris pointed out, it isn't even clear what kind of instance you would have that would require that much heap and whether JIRA works at all with instances that large.

It seems like a better solution would to add a SystemEnvironmentCheck that looks for this scenario and gives the user a warning and a link to a knowledge base article explaining the situation.
fields.summary: when on 32-bit Sun JVMs giving JIRA too much heap can cause bogus Out of Memory Exceptions within Lucene

fields.description:
Currently JIRA allows you to change system file paths at runtime.  

While convenient, this allowed an attacker to elevate his/her stolen system admin access into  a situation where he/her can execute arbitrary code.

A decision has been made to remove the ability to set the paths at run time.  For new installations they will default to JIRA home directories.

For existing instances, the current paths will be used however the UI will not provide a way to change them to anything other than <jirahome>



See JRA-21400 for more details about the current security situation.
fields.summary: The system paths are to be locked down to the JIRA Home directory

fields.description:
When adding a comment that contains Unicode characters outside the BMP (e.g.- ⚔✏Ṣᴔᖲ⋂𒟤ၽ긄ְ𳨒𝴠㧁㸏㱠嫖㰾) JIRA throws the following error (Oops - an error has occurred):

{noformat}
...
Cause:
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Action][id,10030][body,?????????????????][author,admin][level,null][updated,2010-05-04 15:04:55.046][created,2010-05-04 15:04:55.046][issue,10011][rolelevel,null][type,comment][updateauthor,admin] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x92\x9F\xA4\xE1\x81...' for column 'actionbody' at row 1)) 
...
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Action][id,10031][body,?????????????????][author,admin][level,null][updated,2010-05-04 15:07:43.156][created,2010-05-04 15:07:43.156][issue,10011][rolelevel,null][type,comment][updateauthor,admin] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x92\x9F\xA4\xE1\x81...' for column 'actionbody' at row 1))
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.create(DefaultCommentManager.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.create(DefaultCommentManager.java:170)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.create(DefaultCommentManager.java:164)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.DefaultCommentService.create(DefaultCommentService.java:156)
...
{noformat}

It is *IMPORTANT* to note that this error may also crop up when the MySQL server and/or JIRA connection to it are mis-configured. In this case JIRA may also fail for characters in the Unicode BMP (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/SQL+Exception+when+Entering%2C+Updating+or+Importing+an+Issue+in+JIRA+with+MySQL+Due+to+Encoding). In this case this issue does not apply and its just a configuration problem.

This problem only happens in *MySQL* environment. MySQL has a [known limitation|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21224?focusedCommentId=217291&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-217291] in that it is unable to store 4 byte UTF-8 characters in MySQL before 5.5.3. I think we should:

# Add a startup warning admins when JIRA connects to a MySQL database with these problems.
# Update the documentation of MySQL database configuration to indicate this problem.
# Sanatising the input so that this error does not occur when connected to MySQL before 5.5.3. This will probably be much harder than it sounds because JIRA can get input data from anywhere (e.g. CSV, E-Mail, HTTP, SOAP etc). We will probably have to choose our battles.
# Update out documentation to indicate this is the database that gets around this problem.
# Update the upgrade guide once we work out an upgrade path.
fields.summary: MySQL databases incapabable of handling 4-byte UTF-8 Characters. JIRA should handle this gracefully

fields.description:
The performance tests do not send atl security tokens because it would be a huge amount of work to do so.  They do however send a header as above to disable the checks.  This works on the assumption that users cannot modify the headers sent by the browser, from the browser or js.

Jira no longer respects this header, as such the performance tests are broken.
fields.summary: Jira no longer respects the X-Atlassian-Token: no-check header

fields.description:
We use project-specific "Custom Field Configuration schemes" a great deal. It is very inconvenient that creating or modifying them requires jira admin rights.

It would be a really good improvement if, directly in the project admin page, the project administrator could see the custom fields that have a Custom Field Configuration scheme for the project, and could modify them or create new ones - of course, only for this project.

As it stands, we have to have a service requests that project admins can use to request new or modified schemes. This creates a lot of unnecessary overhead.

See support issue "JSP-51066 How to allow project admin to change values in Multi Select custom field"
fields.summary: It should be possible for a project admin to create or modify a "Custom Field Configuration scheme".

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21220].
  {panel}

It would be nice if incoming and outgoing email log go to their own log files. It also should have logging levels so that user can set the level for email to Debug, Info ,Warn and Error accordingly.

JIRA should:
* log the outbound email only (one line per email with recipient and subject).
* Log outbound and incoming email, but no logging of the check for mail operation (every minute)
fields.summary: Separate logs for incoming and outgoing mail

fields.description:
The current documentation page is overwhelming and needs some TLC. We should make it a more directed and step by step guide. 

Section 1 is generally okay, where it becomes a mess is where we offer options. 

For "2. Specify the Host Name or JNDI Location" I think we would be better served by a more directed approach: 

In most instances you should be able to configure your mail server via the JIRA UI:
   <click to expand the "Specify the Host Name">

However, if your mail server requires SSL (e.g. Gmail) or you would like to you a mail server preconfigured with your application server:
    <click to expand the "Specify and configure a JNDI Location (including move the javamail and activation jars, and the optional SSL configuration)"> 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+to+Send+SMTP+Mail
fields.summary: Fix up the SMTP documentation

fields.description:
Bugzilla offers the capability of selecting an existing comment from which to create a new comment.  The text of the existing comment is automatically included in the new comment as a template that new comments can be added into.

Example--

Existing comment #3:
--------------------
text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1
text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1

text1text1text1text1text1text1text1

The new comment edit box is created with the following text in it:
------------------------------------------------------------------
(In reply to comment #3)
> text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1
> text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1text1
> 
> text1text1text1text1text1text1text1

The user can then add their new comments in between the commented lines.
fields.summary: create a new comment with a commented-out comment

fields.description:
Currently the issue service update method expects all fields on the edit screen to have its values re-submitted when called. This is how the HTML interface works and thus is the way the fields expect things to work.

From an API level the issue service is more useful if you can set just a single value and update an issue without over-writing the existing values. This is what the SOAP interface does at the moment.
fields.summary: The issue service update method should allow you to update a single field without over-writing existing field values

Entering the start date is always a pain in the time tracking 

The start date defaults to the current time which is almost always wrong.

Suggestions

* Make the start date default to when the last transition occurred
* Make the start date default to current time minus what is entered in "Time Spent"

I'd be happy with either of these two options.
fields.summary: Make "Start Date" of "Log Work" action smarter to better guess the start time.

fields.description:
In Firefox 3.6 when dragging and dropping a comments permalink (such as onto the desktop as a shortcut) the captured URL is incorrect.

What works:
- left-clicking (as normal)
- left-click dragging into the browsers address bar
- right-clicking and copying
- right-clicking, opening in a new window
- right-clicking, opening in a new tab
- right-clicking, send link

What doesn't work:
- right-click dragging onto the desktop
\\ The copied link is mostly of the permalink of the next comment on the page, but sometimes is even of a previously viewed issue's comment.
\\ This may not occur for the last comment on a page.

Tested in Windows 7
fields.summary: Right Dragging a comments permalink copies URL of wrong permalink on Windows

fields.description:
TO CUSTOMERS WHO MAY BE EXPERIENCING THIS ISSUE

This problem is caused because JIRA 4.1 add a new entry into seraph-config.xml.

{code}
<elevatedsecurityguard class="com.atlassian.jira.security.login.JiraElevatedSecurityGuard"/>
{code}

This line controls the brute force password protection facility.

Customers who simply copy the old seraph-config.xml over the one that ship with JIRA will in effect *remove* this entry.

People will need to re-add this line in order for the LoginGadget to work as expected.

4.1.2 has new code to ensure that this configuration is checked and messages will be logged and placed into the system info page.  

The LoginGadget has also been made less brittle to this missing entry.  

However it is essential that this entry be present since it controls the brute force password protection in JIRA 4.1 and you system is less secure without it.









*Original Description*

Several users in support have reported that when they upgrade to 4.1 that the login gadget stops working. The behavior they see is:

# login.jsp works fine.
# attempting to login via gadget results in the gadget giving a failure message. If you simply refresh the page, however, you *have* been logged in.

This appears to be a side effect of the changes to add CAPTCHA in 4.1 and the resulting changes to the login gadget. I don't know *why* Crowd/Seraph are behaving like this but what happens is that:

# a user gets put into the session
# the authstatuskey is success
# the lastLoginResult is null

In 4.0 we just checked if there was a user in the session to declare "login succeeded". Now we look at lastLoginResult, which is null for reasons yet unknown.

WORKAROUND :   To any customers affected by this bug, the work around is to use the Login link in the top right corner of the page.  This is a link to login.jsp and this is know to work as expected.
fields.summary: Login gadget breaks when crowd is enabled

fields.description: in the "Find Issues" page, the "Issue Attributes" section must include an "Except" checkbox to filter unwanted records. For eg. If I need to view issues whose status is not closed, then there is no option to do so currently.
fields.summary: in the "Find Issues" page, the "Issue Attributes" section must include an "Except" checkbox to filter unwanted records

fields.description:
When viewing tickets in the 'Issues' screens, the sidebar persists.  It would be nice if the user had an option to collapse the sidebar and regain that real estate for viewing the list of issues.

Use Case:
I am a product manager and my Issue lists are very complicated. I rely on have a lot of data values presented to me in regards to many issues.  My issue lists contain so many columns that I have to scroll right to see all of the values.  If I could collapse the sidebar, especially when viewing an already saved filter, then I would regain at least 200 pixels of viewing real estate.
fields.summary: Issues > Sidebar - ability to collapse/toggle the sidebar
Dashboard layout should be more flexible

fields.description:
If I try to view an issue with a very large number of comments (e.g., JRA-1549) using Firefox, as I scroll near the bottom of the page, the page starts drawing in a corrupted way that is completely unreadable.  I have reproduced this both with Firefox 3.0.14 on RHEL5 and Firefox 3.5.5 on Windows XP.  I do not see the problem with IE 8.

I can work around the problem on RHEL5 by resizing the browser window horizontally after the page finishes loading, but I cannot find any workaround for Windows.  It's impossible to read the comments near the end of the issue.
fields.summary: Unable to view issues with large numbers of comments

fields.description:
In the GUI configuration tool (bin/config.bat), the home directory configuration displays the path using windows-style backslashes for the directory separator character. If the config is saved without changing these to forward slashes, JIRA will fail to start with an error that says to make them forward slashes on windows.

It'd be nice if the tool didn't write an invalid config in the first place.
fields.summary: Windows: JIRA configuration tool writes backslashes in home directory

fields.description: I have created several custom fields which are using the wiki renderer which looks fine in the issue screen but does not render correctly in the activity stream when this field is updated.
fields.summary: Email body and Activity Stream gadget does not render wiki text for custom fields

fields.description:
The Time Tracking Permissions for the Default Permission Scheme - look wrong

By default the Project Role (Developers) has "Work On Issues", but the Project role (Users) has "Edit Own Worklogs" and "Delete Own Worklogs". 

I believe the latter two permissions should also default to the Project Role (Developers).
fields.summary: Default Permission Scheme - Time Tracking Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21195].
  {panel}

With the new issue detail view coming with JIRA 4.1 we have real trouble because every existing custom field of the types
* date picker
* datetime picker

is now displayed on the right column under "*Dates*"!

Since we are heavily using these kinds of custom fields especially for adding functional information and not for issue processing purposes: E.g. 'starting date' and 'ending date' as descriptive information of the ticket (e.g. the travel) and not as planning information when the issue should be started and finished.

*My improvement proposal would be that these custom fields should be adjustable where it should be displayed in the screen*

This and JRA-21013 are currently for us *show stoppers* to update our and our customer JIRA insances!
fields.summary: Custom fields of the types Date & DateTime picker shouldn't be displayed under the new pane "Dates" by default

fields.description:
So after a normal Windows install the jira-application.properties is read-only for example.

But this file needs to be edited to change the jira.home.

We also need to be able to change the following:
* server.xml and entityengine.xml
* osuser.xml, seraph-config.xml etc (bunch of stuff under WEB-INF/classes - but not the classes)
* Need to be able to add Plugins1 plugins to WEB-INF/lib
* ...
fields.summary: Windows installer sets all installation folders as read-only - but you need to edit some files in here.
JIRA config tool does not like "escaped colons" in the jira-application.properties file

fields.description:
The page detailing how to change the log4j.properties file to add debug-level information to the logs is missing from the JIRA 4.1.1 documentation. [It exists for 4.0|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA040/Changing+JIRA%27s+log+output].

But when running through the Integrating JIRA with LDAP document, the ["Cannot authenticate against LDAP password"|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+LDAP#IntegratingJIRAwithLDAP-CannotauthenticateagainstLDAPpassword] instructions, step 1 has a link to [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+JIRA%27s+log+output] and it gives a "A page with this title has been deleted. Contact your space administrator if you would like it restored" message.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- add custom fields under tabs on the Issue View screen (except fields that won't appear under tabs, such as dates) and populate the fields for an issue
- view the issue and custom tabs show all fields under the first custom tab
- clicking on any custom tab will show their own fields correctly, but clicking on *any* Activity tab will produce the bug again 
- clicking on an Activity tab apart from All and reloading the issue does not restore the display as it should as the problem occurs on page load

Tested in Firefox 3 and IE 8
